message.content:
<<<api>>>: javax.imageio.ImageIO
<<<code>>>: // Create a JPEG writer
ImageWriter writer = ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("jpeg").next();

// Set the compression quality
ImageWriteParam param = writer.getDefaultWriteParam();
param.setCompressionMode(ImageWriteParam.MODE_EXPLICIT);
param.setCompressionQuality(0.5f); // Set the desired compression level (0.0f - 1.0f)

// Save the image with the specified compression level
File output = new File(folder.toString() + "/" + filename + ".jpg");
ImageOutputStream ios = ImageIO.createImageOutputStream(output);
writer.setOutput(ios);
writer.write(null, new IIOImage(capture, null, null), param);
ios.close();
writer.dispose();
<<<explanation>>>: To set the compression level for a JPEG file using ImageIO, you need to use the javax.imageio.ImageWriter class. First, you create an instance of the JPEG writer using ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("jpeg").next(). Then, you can set the compression quality using the ImageWriteParam class. Set the compression mode to MODE_EXPLICIT and set the compression quality to a value between 0.0f and 1.0f, where 0.0f is the lowest quality and 1.0f is the highest quality. Finally, save the image using the specified compression level by calling writer.write().
